medical_history.chief_complaint: Confusion, dizziness, memory impairment, and recurrent vomiting over 2 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks prior to admission, with a decline leading to unconsciousness a day after admission. The patient was intubated due to suspected severe aspiration pneumonia and remained in a deep coma on day 5, showing no motor responses by day 12 and passing away on day 15.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was over 70 years of age and from a BoDV-1-endemic region of southern Germany.
